questions.promptMd: Which opening MOST effectively sets a collaborative frame?

answers.contentMd: State joint goals, propose a 3‑part agenda, and offer a package to explore trades
answers.feedbackMd: Aligns interests, sets structure, and invites collaboration.

answers.contentMd: Start with a single number and "non‑negotiable" stance
answers.feedbackMd: Positional and brittle; harms value creation.

answers.contentMd: Ask the other side to set the agenda entirely
Tell a long backstory before any goals

questions.promptMd: Which move BEST resets a derailed agenda?

answers.contentMd: Summarize progress, restate agenda, and time‑box the current topic
Match the other side’s volume and argue
Ignore derail and push your point

questions.promptMd: True or False: Process agreements (who decides, how, and when) should be set early.

answers.feedbackMd: Correct. Clear process reduces later friction.
Process ambiguity invites stalls and surprises.
